title: How do you play adc with random supports
body: any tips on how to play adc with support that do not have your play style such as i could be a passive farming laner but the support likes to go super agro and dies because im not ready to commit to an all in.

replies.body: I play both; what you have to do is get a feel for each other and play off of each other.  Pay attention to each others' positioning, watch his movements, try to look and find out what he is thinking based upon his actions.  After a little bit you should both be on the same page and reacting quickly to what each other are doing.

Have you told your supports what type of player you are?  
Most aggressive  supports are actually passive players themselves.  The reason why most supports play aggressive is mainly because when they have a passive/farm type of ADC and they get AA once they feel like they need to attack or run the risk of getting yelled at by their ADC because they got hit while the support didn't do anything. 
  
  What I do is the "2 call rule" when I play ADC. 
CALL ONE 
If my support pings on the enemy team which means "go In" I GO IN no matter if I personally think it's a bad call or not I commit because they pinged it and they have pretty much already made up their mind and now so do you. 
If you don't go in the 1st time but your support does and they die as you watch you will run the risk of being 1v2 the rest of the game. 

CALL TWO
Call two is the after math of call one.  If call two didn't work( say we both died giving a double kill to the enemy adc)  I DON'T LISTEN to my support until my team groups and what ever happened in the lane phase doesn't matter as much.   The reason is because I tried their way(my support) on their call/play and now being the ADC I do my own thinking.  If Call one did work and we got a kill or a double kill either I got both kills or my support got 1 or my support got both, I listen to their next call( if it's not broke don't fix it).  

 That's just my own 2cents on the matter.

Coming from the other side of things... I'm a support main, and it can be quite difficult not knowing what my adc wants to do if it's someone I've never played with before.  And as I play most of my matches either alone, or with friends in other lanes, that's most of my adcs.  I try to ask in champ select what kind of playstyle the adc has, as far as how aggro they want to be, and pings and such are always a good tool for when to look to go in for a trade.  

It never hurts to let your support know before the match starts that you want to focus on farming, or that you want to try and go for early kills.  Or even just to ask them what they might like to do as well.  The only warning I will say, is if you use pings to let your support know that you want to go in, and you are waiting on them to initiate, don't forget that they are keeping track of many things before they go in.  A good support will be watching for where the enemy jungler is, health and mana bars, ability cooldowns, summoner spell cooldowns, the numbers of creeps in the wave, how close they are to leveling up vs how close the enemy might be to leveling up, any missing enemy laners, etc.  I don't always have time to explain those things to my adc, but if he wants me to go in and I don't, it's because I have a darn good reason for it.

You don't suicide for your support if he does mistakes, but you help him  to ensure lane dominance. Don't forget to ward too cuz his charges aren't infinite.
Ps. I really hate passive ADC. It  makes me rage when I put all my efforts, mana and HP yet ADC  does nothing. 
Don't forget, that ADC and Support are both equal players and should find synergy. You can't say just because I don't like your play style you should adapt to my style.
